verses.verse: And afterward<WH310> Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> went in<WH935>, and told<WH559> Pharaoh<WH6547>, Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, Let my people<WH5971> go<WH7971>, that they may hold a feast<WH2287> unto me in the wilderness<WH4057>.

And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559>, Who is the Lord<WH3068>, that I should obey<WH8085> his voice<WH6963> to let Israel<WH3478> go<WH7971>? I know<WH3045> not the Lord<WH3068>, neither will I let Israel<WH3478> go<WH7971>.

And they said<WH559>, The God<WH430> of the Hebrews<WH5680> has met<WH7122> with us<WH3212>: let us go, we pray you three<WH7969> days<WH3117>' journey<WH1870> into the desert<WH4057>, and sacrifice<WH2076> unto the Lord<WH3068> our God<WH430>; lest he fall<WH6293> upon us with pestilence<WH1698>, or with the sword<WH2719>.

And the king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> said<WH559> unto them<WH4872>, why do you Moses and Aaron<WH175>, let<WH6544> the people<WH5971> from their works<WH4639>? Get<WH3212> you unto your burdens<WH5450>.
And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559>, Behold<WH5971>, the people of the land<WH776> now are many<WH7227>, and you make them rest<WH7673> from their burdens<WH5450>.
And Pharaoh<WH6547> commanded<WH6680> the same day<WH3117> the taskmasters<WH5065> of the people<WH5971>, and their officers<WH7860>, saying<WH559>,
you shall no more<WH3254> give<WH5414> the people<WH5971> straw<WH8401> to make<WH3835> brick<WH3843>, as before<WH8032>: let them go<WH3212> and gather<WH7197> straw for themselves<WH8401>.

And the number<WH4971> of the bricks<WH3843>, which they did make<WH6213> before<WH8032>, you shall lay<WH7760> upon them<WH1639>; you shall not diminish anything there for they be idle<WH7503>; therefore they cry<WH6817>, saying<WH559>, Let us go<WH3212> and sacrifice<WH2076> to our God<WH430>.
Let there more work<WH5656> be laid<WH3513> upon the men<WH582>, that they may labor<WH6213> in it and let them not regard<WH8159> lying<WH8267> words<WH1697>.

And the taskmasters<WH5065> of the people<WH5971> went out<WH3318>, and their officers<WH7860>, and they spoke<WH559> to the people<WH5971>, saying<WH559>, Thus says<WH559> Pharaoh<WH6547>, I will not give<WH5414> you straw<WH8401>.
Go<WH3212> you get<WH3947> you straw<WH8401> where<WH834> you can find<WH4672> it<WH3588>: yet not anything<WH1697> of your work<WH5656> shall be diminished<WH1639>.
So the people<WH5971> were scattered abroad<WH6327> throughout all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> to gather<WH7197> stubble<WH7179> instead of straw<WH8401>.
And the taskmasters<WH5065> hurried<WH213> them<WH559>, saying, fulfill<WH3615> your works<WH4639>, your daily<WH3117> tasks<WH1697>, as when there was<WH1961> straw<WH8401>.

And the officers<WH7860> of the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, which Pharaoh<WH6547>'s taskmasters<WH5065> had set<WH7760> over them<WH5221>, were beaten, and demanded<WH559>, why have you not fulfilled<WH3615> your task<WH2706> in making brick<WH3835> both yesterday<WH8543> and to day<WH3117>, as before<WH8032>?
Then the officers<WH7860> of the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> came<WH935> and cried<WH6817> unto Pharaoh<WH6547>, saying<WH559>, why deal<WH6213> you thus with your servants<WH5650>?

There is no straw<WH8401> given<WH5414> unto your servants<WH5650>, and they say<WH559> to us<WH6213>, Make brick<WH3843>: and<WH5650>, behold, your servants are beaten<WH5221>; but the fault<WH2398> is in your own people<WH5971>.
But he said<WH559>, you are idle<WH7503>, you are idle<WH7503>: therefore you say<WH559>, Let us go<WH3212> and do sacrifice<WH2076> to the Lord<WH3068>.
Go<WH3212> therefore now<WH5647>, and work; for there shall no straw<WH8401> be given<WH5414> you<WH5414>, yet shall you deliver the number<WH8506> of bricks<WH3843>.

And the officers<WH7860> of the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> did see<WH7200> that they were in evil<WH7451> case<WH559>, after it was said, you shall not diminish<WH1639> anything from your bricks<WH3843> of your daily<WH3117> task<WH1697>.
And they met<WH6293> Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175>, who stood<WH5324> in the way<WH7125>, as they came forth<WH3318> from Pharaoh<WH6547>:

And they said<WH559> unto them<WH3068>, The Lord look<WH7200> upon you<WH8199>, and judge; because you have made our smell<WH7381> to be abhorred<WH887> in the eyes<WH5869> of Pharaoh<WH6547>, and in the eyes<WH5869> of his servants<WH5650>, to put<WH5414> a sword<WH2719> in their hand<WH3027> to kill us<WH2026>.
And Moses<WH4872> returned<WH7725> unto the Lord<WH3068>, and said<WH559>, Lord<WH136>, why have you so evilly afflicted<WH7489> this people<WH5971>? Why is it that you have sent me<WH7971>?

For since I came<WH935> to Pharaoh<WH6547> to speak<WH1696> in your name<WH8034>, he has done evil<WH7489> to this people<WH5971>; neither have you delivered<WH5337> your people<WH5971> at all<WH5337>.
